import time
#genes = df.copy()
genes = pd.DataFrame()
t0 = time.time()
for i in top_correlated:# range(len(df)):
    entrez_gene_ID = df['old'].iat[i]
    kaggle_id = df['new'].iat[i]
    
    #try:
    g_inf = mg.getgene(entrez_gene_ID)
        #print(i,ens_id)
        #print(g.keys())
    list1 = ['symbol',   'type_of_gene', 'map_location' ,   'name', 'entrezgene', 'alias', 'other_names' , 'summary' ] 
    for k in list1:
        if k in g_inf.keys():
            genes.loc[i,k] = str(g_inf[k]) 
            
    if 'generif' in g_inf.keys():
        genes.loc[i,'count pubmed'] = len(g_inf['generif'])            
            
genes

# What is about ?



From: https://www.kaggle.com/alexandervc/moa-correlation-analysis-use-igraph

There is group of 34 genes which are quite strongly correllated: Genes: [37, 38, 50, 58, 63, 72, 121, 123, 131, 147, 185, 186, 195, 228, 248, 257, 261, 328, 349, 369, 386, 406, 410, 417, 439, 460, 489, 569, 629, 672, 731, 744, 760, 761] (strongly means that correlation threshold is 0.78, and these genes connected between each other by correlation, see details below).


Here we will ouput info on these genes. (Since genes name information became available).
